sen.j: 林 きむ子（はやし きむこ、明治17年（1884年） - 昭和42年（1967年））は舞踏家、作家、社会運動家、実業家。
sen.e: Kimuko HAYASHI (1884 - 1967) was a dancer, author, social activist and a businesswoman.
Kimuko HAYASHI (1884 - 1967) was a dancer, author, social activist and a businesswoman.
Kimuko HAYASHI (1884 - 1967) was a dancer, author, social activist and a businesswoman.

sen.j: 大正三美人の一人として数えられる場合もある。
sen.e: She was counted one of amongst the three beautiful women in the Taisho period.
She was counted amongst the three beautiful women in the Taisho period.
sen.cmt: one of を削除しました。
sen.e: She was counted amongst the three beautiful women in the Taisho period.
Her koseki(the household register) name was Kin.
Her koseki(the household register) name was Kin.
Her koseki(the household register) name was Kin.

sen.j: きむ子は東京の柳橋に生まれ、父は狂言浄瑠璃の祖といわれる初代豊竹和園太夫。
sen.e: She was born in Yanagibashi, Tokyo and her father was the first generation Toyotake Kazusonotayu who was said to be an originator of Kyogen(farce played during Noh play cycle) Joruri (Ballad drama).
She was born in Yanagibashi, Tokyo and her father was the first generation Toyotake Kazusonotayu who was said to be an originator of Kyogen(farce played during Noh play cycle) Joruri (Ballad drama).
She was born in Yanagibashi, Tokyo and her father was the first generation Toyotake Kazusonotayu who was said to be an originator of Kyogen(farce played during Noh play cycle) Joruri (Ballad drama).

sen.j: 母は浄瑠璃初代の竹本素行。
sen.e: Mother was the first generation of Joruri TAKEMOTO Soko.
Mother was the first generation of Joruri TAKEMOTO Soko.
Mother was the first generation of Joruri TAKEMOTO Soko.

sen.j: 異父弟に曾我廼家弁天、藤間林太郎。
sen.e: Benten SOGANOYA and Rintaro TOMA were half brothers.
Benten SOGANOYA and Rintaro TOMA were her half brothers.
Benten SOGANOYA and Rintaro TOMA were her half brothers.

sen.j: 俳優の藤田まことは甥に当たる。
sen.e: Actor Makoto FUJITA was her nephew.
Actor Makoto FUJITA was her nephew.
Actor Makoto FUJITA was her nephew.

sen.j: 七歳のときに新橋の料亭｢浜の家｣の女将内田はな(花)の養女となり、跡を継ぐように望まれ、三味線、踊り、お茶、お花など、ありとあらゆる芸事を身につけたという。
sen.e: She was adopted by a fancy Japanese-style restaurant Hananoya's lady owner Hana UCHIDA at her wish to succeed the place when she was seven and began all sorts of training in traditional arts that include shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo), Japanese dancing, flower arrangement and so forth.

She was adopted by a fancy Japanese-style restaurant Hananoya's lady owner Hana UCHIDA at her wish to succeed the place when she was seven and began all sorts of training in traditional arts that include shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo), Japanese dancing, flower arrangement and so forth.

She was adopted by a fancy Japanese-style restaurant Hananoya's lady owner Hana UCHIDA at her wish to succeed the place when she was seven and began all sorts of training in traditional arts that include shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo), Japanese dancing, flower arrangement and so forth.

sen.j: 養家｢浜の家｣は頭山満や杉山茂丸が贔屓にし、当時は名の知れた料亭であった。
sen.e: Adopted house"Hamanoya" was a well known restaurant frequented by Mitsuru TOYAMA and Shigemaru SUGIYAMA at the time.
Adopted house"Hamanoya" was a well known restaurant frequented by Mitsuru TOYAMA and Shigemaru SUGIYAMA at the time.
Adopted house"Hamanoya" was a well known restaurant frequented by Mitsuru TOYAMA and Shigemaru SUGIYAMA at the time.

sen.j: 後に最初の夫となる日向輝武と結婚するが、大浦事件によって輝武は狂死してしまう。
sen.e: Later, she married to Terutake HYUGA who died crazed with grief by Oura scandal.
Later, she married Terutake HYUGA, who died crazed with grief by Oura scandal.
sen.cmt: toを削除しました。HYUGAの後にカンマを追加しました。
sen.e: Later, she married Terutake HYUGA, who died crazed with grief by Oura scandal.

sen.j: その後、夫が死んで1年以内に6人の子供がいながら、9歳年下の林柳波と結婚したことは大正スキャンダルとして大きな話題となった。
sen.e: Later she remarried to Ryuha HAYASHI who was nine years younger within a year of her first husband death with six children and this stirred up to become a big scandalous news of the Taisho period.
Later she remarried Ryuha HAYASHI, who was nine years younger within a year of her first husband death with six children and this became a big scandalous news of the Taisho period.
sen.cmt: toを削除しました。stirred up to becomeをbecameに変更しました。
sen.e: Later she remarried Ryuha HAYASHI, who was nine years younger within a year of her first husband death with six children and this became a big scandalous news of the Taisho period.

sen.j: 後に娘の美登里が亡くなる頃に夫の柳波は別の女性との間に子供が生まれて、夫はその女性のところに行き帰ってこなかったが、離婚はしなかった。
sen.e: Her husband Ryuha had a child with another woman around the time her daughter Mitori died and he never returned but they did not divorce.
Her husband Ryuha had a child with another woman around the time her daughter Midori died and he never returned but they did not divorce.
Her husband Ryuha had a child with another woman around the time her daughter Midori died and he never returned but they did not divorce.
